content.description: scramble to first bolt at little roof.   Pull roof(crux) to stance at second bolt.   Climb over 2 more bolts to anchors

Slab up to a new bolt at 25+' (instead of the 30+') with no gear. Under the route and slightly left is a right upwardly slanting ramp that will get you to the first bolt at about 5.6 or 5.7. Also a more direct start on steeper slab weighs in at 8+.

 Climb crack to shuts. There are perma-biners up there for easy descent and they appear good, but they have been there since 2012.

 I know. Before the flame war starts, we tried leading on trad. Falling on gear ripped the rock off the cliff. Luckily no one was seriously injured. One such failure did create a great finger pocket reducing the grade down to its current 10a.
content.protection: Bolts or for the purist nuts.
content.location: 20' left of Dopamine.   Line with very high Bolt at tiny crack.

content.description: Climb bolts just right of Dopamine.   Cruxy from 2nd to 4th bolt.   Fairly steep for slab and crimpy.   The first ascent was missing the fist bolt.    It has since been retro bolted (obviously).   Continue to shared anchors
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts and shared anchor with Dopamine

content.description: Climb blunt arete 8' left of Honeysuckle passing 3 bolts. Place gear for your second (big nut or small cam) and traverse right(easy) to anchors.
content.protection: Bolts and 1" piece of pro for directional at top

content.description: Climb up steep slab to first bolt.   Lie back tufa like ridge to second bolt and pull little roof.   Move to third bolt. Make thin moves to fourth bolt(crux) and then to anchors.
Climb through 2 bolts(crux). Then a short hand crack with large stoppers and a #1 Camalot.
content.location: The start is located 50' north of Dopamine. About 15' up a hill side behind some trees. There are two bolts on the bottom half of the route followed by a hand crack above.

content.description: Climb left angling crack to corner then follow corner up right. Finish on trees or Levitation anchors
Southern most route in  this area.   climb flake/crack to V-notch place small gear and finish to anchors
content.protection: bolts and black  tricam; blue or green alien

content.description: climb face with decent holds to very short shallow left facing corner (crux), then up right to a bolt and then anchors.
content.location: Middle crag with 3 lines together. This is the route in the middle

content.description: Climb easy dihedral to high first bolt. Make hard moves right on lousy feet eventually gaining a slopey pocket with your left hand. Gain a not-so-great pinch/pocket with your right, do a few more hard moves, then giggle your way through easy moves to the anchor.
content.location: To the left of Scary Larry

content.description: Climb to left facing corner to undercling flake, move left to left facing corner. Next move up and left over slight bulge to steeper juggy bulge and anchors.
content.protection:
A bit tricky. There is a spike of rock directly where you don't want one. Here's how we did it:

 1. Clip the 1st bolt from the ground with a single biner. Start to the right at a small left facing corner.     Climb corner to under cling flake, moving left past 1st bolt.     Then purposely "Z" clip second bolt then UNclip 1st bolt due to rock rub

 or

 2. stick clip 2nd bolt and then clip 1st bolt to leader's strand (you will be unable to avoid rock rub) , which will then be unclipped when passing.

 either way continue following remaining bolts. 4-5 bolts and 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Just uphill and right of Better Than it Seams

content.description: Start with a big move up to a hanging flake. Traverse right and mantle. Stay off the boulder behind you. Find thin fingers in the seam. Make tricky moves to a horizontal. More tricky moves to jugs and then pull a small roof to anchors.
Climb through 3 bolts to shared anchor.   Be careful not to go left around the corner, dubious rock.
10 routes on 3 small crags right on the trail.   Routes range 5.7 to 5.11.   Some routes are mixed. Rack: Set of Stoppers (1-13), Black and Pink Tricam, Blue and Green Alien, #1 Camalot.
